text: @realDonaldTrump @CDCgov @SecAzar Trump promised yesterday nothing to worry about with coronavirus. Here's what we are waking up to: France reported first death, Spain confirmed 8 new cases and new infections reported in Croatia, Greece, Iran, Austria and Switzerland. South Korea now up to more than 1,200 sick

entity.name: President Trump announces ‘hard hitting’ sanctions on Iran
entity.description: President Trump said he’s imposing sanctions on Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, and his office, “in response to Iran’s increasingly provocative actions.” The announcement comes after Iran shot down a US Navy drone last week.

entity.name: Iran's deputy health minister tests positive for coronavirus a day after playing down outbreak fears
entity.description: During a televised press conference in Tehran on Monday, Iraj Harirchi was seen coughing and sweating while he assured the public that the coronavirus "situation is almost stable in the country." The Iranian deputy health minister, who is in charge of containing the spread of the pathogen, confirmed he tested positive for the virus the following day and is now under quarantine. The Islamic republic is currently amid a major outbreak with 15 dead, the largest outside of China.
